result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnnie A Hargon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All court costs, assessments, and surcharges (including DNA and any domestic violence surcharge); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
Provide a DNA sample.
No contact with the victim unless approved by a Children's Court order.

Complete and assessments and counseling deemed appropriate by the probation agent.
Complete a parenting class.
Comply with any conditions established by a Children's Court order.
Absolute sobriety, unless prescribed by a physician.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $558.00 entered as ordered by the court on 10/29/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 11/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Received, signed and filed:
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs.
Paperwork forwarded to Sandy Cottrill in Room 104 of the Courthouse.
cab

Defendant Johnnie A Hargon in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State. For reasons stated on the record, case passed.  Statements by the defense and defendant.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to Counts 2 and 3.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to Counts 1 and 3.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to Counts 1 and 2.

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on 16 MONTHS probation.


  Conditions of Probation:
- Complete and assessments and counseling deemed appropriate by the probation agent.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Comply with any conditions established by a Children's Court order.
- Absolute sobriety, unless prescribed by a physician.
- No contact with the victim unless approved by a Children's Court order.
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court advised the defendant that they may never possess a firearm.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, assessments, and surcharges (including DNA and any domestic violence surcharge); 
All applicable fees of supervision.


Filed:  
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing.

Defendant Johnnie A Hargon in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
AS TO COUNT 1
On a motion of the state pursuant to plea negotiations, the court amended Count 1 to 3 counts: 
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed & Filed, Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements.

Defendant Johnnie A Hargon in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan. Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Defense counsel requested a plea hearing. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnnie A Hargon in court PRO SE.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Patrick Flanagan present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $60.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning the 1st of the month after the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Status of Counsel date in branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnnie A Hargon not in court, defendant in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case called on Court's own motion regarding DNA.  Court determined pursuant to statute this case is NOT required to have a DNA sample.  Court ordered previous DNA ordered rescinded.  All other conditions remain the same.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BNS dob 8/1/02, unless as approved per Children's Court Orders, or if CHildren's Court is not involved, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare

Defendant Johnnie A Hargon in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Johnnie A Hargon in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 3809 North Humboldt Blvd, #207, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
